lenders.name: Tasha

lenders.name: Rhonda
lenders.loan_because:
We really can make a difference. It's exciting for me to know that people are being helped on a personal level in such a huge way with so little from lenders. 
My focus is on lending to people in Mexico, Central and South America. Many complain that people from these regions come to the U.S.
 illegally to work. The fact of the matter is, they would gladly stay in their own countries with their families if they had a way to make a living. Mothers and fathers leave their children with relatives and are gone for many years. Sometimes, young children run away and come to the U.S. looking for the parent that they miss so dearly. Some lose their lives on that journey. Many endure experiences no young person should have to go through.
lenders.occupational_info:
I'm a photographer and love what  I do. Many people over the years have helped me in small ways that have made a tremendous difference for me.  

Being a lender on Kiva allows me to do the same for others in a small way and yet have a global impact.  It's a really good feeling!

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because:
How could I not?? What a wonderful opportunity to make connections with other people across the globe and contribute to their success and future! :)

Rebecca Masters
MA
lenders.occupational_info: I coordinate the Holyoke Youth Task Force, a coalition of non-profit organizations and state agencies dedicated to the betterment of youth in Holyoke, MA.

lenders.name: Clive
lenders.loan_because: What a fabulous organisation to set this up & allow people like myself the opportunity to help fellow entrepreneurs out in countries where loans are needed.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people take the hassle out of their lives when they are buying or selling Real Estate by handling and taking care of all the details for them throughout the lengthy process of their transaction.  Fortunately, I get to do this in a superbly beautiful coastal location named Port Stephens with 25 fabulous beaches to enjoy.

My small team of experts assisted emerging market countries borrow funds from various Multilateral Developmernt Banks -- primarily the World Bank.

lenders.name: SIFE Ryerson
lenders.loan_because: SIFE Ryerson is dedicated to fostering entrepreneurship.
lenders.occupational_info: SIFE Ryerson aims to create new economic opportunity by creating and implementing innovative projects at Ryerson University, in the community, and around the world.

lenders.name: Taylor
lenders.occupation: Commercial Real Estate Smart Growth Development
lenders.loan_because: others all over the world deserve the same chance I've been given
lenders.occupational_info: I work on behalf of land owners who want to change the use of their land and they have to go through community meetings to do it.

lenders.name: naheed gilani, calgary
lenders.loan_because: It provides those less fortunate a spark of hope to help them escape despair and degradation.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people manage their finances and increase their wealth to prepare for retirement or other major goals

lenders.name: Regina
lenders.loan_because: Pay It Forward.

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.loan_because: poverty is such a big issue and this is one small way that I can help out.

lenders.name: Labros
lenders.loan_because: We must help our fellow human beings that are less fortunate than we are.
lenders.occupational_info: I help my company reduce the magnitude of our problems using systematic team-based problem-solving techniques. It sounds confusing, but it has been very interesting and gratifying.

lenders.name: Sue
lenders.loan_because: because we need to help give others a chance to get in a better place.

lenders.name: Alex
lenders.loan_because:
I've been so fortunate....raised with such incredible kindness and love. If it wasn't for the direct care and love of a random soul that my Mom met in her time of need, I wouldn't have made it to where I am today. 

I should do what I can to help others, the same way that I have been helped myself. :)
lenders.occupational_info: What do I do? Well...I do my best to avoid my studying as long as possible. haha.

lenders.name: erik kulick
lenders.loan_because: I always loved the idea of micro-loans, so when I heard about this program, I had to pitch in.
lenders.occupational_info: I am graduating in Geography this December, so hopefully one of the companies that I sent my resume to will higher me so I can support my young family.

lenders.name: TImothy
lenders.loan_because: this seams like a good way to make positive change.
lenders.occupational_info: I do scientific research on the physical world.

lenders.name: Angela and Arju
lenders.loan_because: it's an opportunity for us to help aspiring (and inspiring!) people.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: We all need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired after making things including R.L. Winston fly reels, optical instrumentation, vacuum instrumentation and bio-medical instrumentation. Had things I made blow up with the U.S. Space Shuttle.

lenders.name: Pearlette
lenders.loan_because: I can.  I believe that everyone has the ability to give a helping hand to another.
lenders.occupational_info: Empowering people to help themselves by helping others.

lenders.name: Katie Felten
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others make their dreams a reality.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people remember everyone they meet and track those relationships over time through an app called Hashable.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: It feels great!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a second grade teacher in a public school.

lenders.name: Reggie
lenders.loan_because: I'm happy, and I'm happy because I loan.  It's a vicious cycle!
lenders.occupational_info: I help companies figure out how to make or save money

lenders.name: Payton Family
lenders.loan_because: I love to help those people who truly need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I read reports from a variety of sources.  I try to make sense of it all and compile a single report to be read by important people.  I also manage teams and large projects.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I am grateful for the resources that I have in my life and would like to help others however possible!

lenders.name: Johan
lenders.loan_because: In Memory of Mojo

lenders.name: Michelle
lenders.loan_because: we all need someone to believe in us
lenders.occupational_info: I work in strategic planning for an information technology branch in the federal government.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: I care about social justice and equality.

lenders.name: Cameron
lenders.loan_because: Because my school wants to help people who don't have enough but want to make a good life, and work hard.

lenders.name: Brentano
lenders.loan_because: big banks are bad

lenders.name: Monica
lenders.loan_because: I believe fully that everyone should provide a "help up" to others in need.  KIVA is but a small way to do that.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a girl focused  non-profit organization.  I am responsible for generating working capital for the corporation through planned giving, member giving campaigns, corporate grants, trusts, and  individual doner campaigns.

lenders.name: Michael And Amanda
lenders.loan_because:
I give because I am wired to give. Growing up, my parents, who were much less blessed financially than I am today, gave every chance they got. The spirit of giving is something that is embedded in my genes and that I am trying to carry forward with my children.
I give personally because as a MWD supervisor for a major drilling service company, my family and I are blessed, and it's important to share that blessing and give to those others who may be less fortunate and in need. I give because it's the right thing to do. In this global economy we are all neighbors, and when we can, if we can, however we can, we should help one another. I give because as a successful Canadian  person living in North America, I feel that I have an obligation to help people, and anyone else who might be in need. In my eyes, Kiva is one of the best ways to make a difference helping people become self-sufficient.
lenders.occupational_info: Helping to drill for oil and gas

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: I believe in humanity

lenders.name: Jon and Jen
lenders.loan_because: We believe in teaching a man to fish.
lenders.occupational_info: Tooth doctor

lenders.name: Ed  & Nuan
lenders.loan_because: Hey, it's fun and I enjoy helping out folks that are hard workers and ambitious. I have a special connection to Cambodia and am intrigued by the ancient Khmer Civilization from its beginning in the Kulen Mountains to its influence on Thai culture.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach and counsel International and immigrant  students and enjoy my ever continuing cultural and spiritual lessons that  I receive from them.

lenders.name: Giana
lenders.loan_because:
I recognise the connection between all farmers all over the world, we have European privilege.  I like
to support others with greater struggles.
lenders.occupational_info: My family farm 250 acres in Ireland - we keep cows for milk from which we make cheese, the whey we feed to pigs, our son then produces bacon, salami and hams.  we have 5 Farmer's Markets where we sell our produce.

lenders.name: Olaf
lenders.occupational_info: Statistics

lenders.name: Nikola
lenders.loan_because: I want to support people and help make microfinancing more popular!
lenders.occupational_info: easy :-)

lenders.name: Miguel
lenders.loan_because: I don't find a reason not to!

lenders.name: Alexis
lenders.loan_because: i'm better banker than Lehman Brothers.

lenders.name: Dan Yell
lenders.loan_because: I am Rad
lenders.occupational_info: Rad

lenders.name: Aubry
lenders.loan_because: If I give $100 a month to charity, that is $100 a month for the rest of my life.  If I give $100 a month through microloans, that is $100 a month until repayment on the first wave starts coming back, then it is $200 a month until the second wave starts coming back, and then it is $300 a month.
lenders.occupational_info: People break computers.  I un-break them.

lenders.name: Nestori Virtanen
lenders.loan_because: I see no reason why not to loan.
lenders.occupational_info: Taking photos in South America during my trip without a destination.

lenders.name: connie
lenders.loan_because: In memory of my Aunt Iva Mae who died as an infant.

lenders.name: Bev
lenders.loan_because: I love my brothers and sisters in Christ.  Hopefully, my native country, Philippines will be a part of this organization as I am reserving my very first loan to my fellow kababayan --- I made my very first loan! Thank God ksama napo and pnas d2 :-) --  One need not be born rich nor hold a position to be able to reach out and lend a hand; YOU can make a DIFFERENCE!

lenders.name: Neelofer
lenders.loan_because: I loan money because it's the least I can do as a person of privilege in a world of unfairly distributed wealth. I loan my time because I hope to maintain a mutually beneficial relationship with the natural world and its inhabitants who give to me in countless ways.

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: I've received help from family and friends when I needed it and I like to help others. I chose the farming project because I like to garden and understand the importance of having good soil!
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist, writer and design consultant for businesses and nonprofit organizations. I paint and exhibit my paintings in galleries. I write and illustrate books. I help people communicate about their businesses and projects by designing their brochures, websites, and brand identities. My husband and I also create books and songs for children. He's a musician and composer.

lenders.name: Calvin
lenders.loan_because: It helps in a significant way to improve actual lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I was an administrator at a major American University for 15 years and retired in October of 2008.  I also help to encourage talented young filmmakers produce independent film projects.

lenders.name: Fr.Dennis
lenders.loan_because: I love the way microlending intersects communitarian ideals and the free market. Helping people bring their ideas to life so that they can meet the needs of their families... As a Christian, this is something I can support.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a relatively new Catholic priest (since June 2008) and work at a parish in Memphis. There are 1800 families here, and I make the Sacraments available to them. I preach. I preside at worship. I baptize children and adults. I visit the sick. I teach. I console those in mourning. I help couples prepare for marriage. I pray for you.

lenders.name: Misha
lenders.loan_because: I give a shit about other people.
lenders.occupational_info: I take all the material that was recorded for a movie and put it together like a puzzle.

lenders.name: Rafael
lenders.loan_because: I believe we should all have an opportunity, I believe in people´s efforts, and I think this world is unbalanced.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a company with some partners so I can bring money home every day. This company does information technologies services to other companies.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: "We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give." Winston Churchill

lenders.name: Holger
lenders.loan_because:
Former entrepreneur, now working in the environmental sector, I like to support other people to start/develop/maintain their businesses to empower them leading a better life and escape poverty. Kiva is only one thing.
There are many other possibilities for support: Plan international, Myc4, fair-pla.net etc.
lenders.occupational_info: I try to detect polluntants in the environment

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.loan_because: I believe in small businesses and I want to support woman-owned businesses in particular.  I want to help women succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a lawyer and I am also the mother of two children.

lenders.name: ravindren
lenders.loan_because: want to help people whom really need for good reason.
lenders.occupational_info: mechanical engineer in a well known electronic com.

lenders.name: Alan
lenders.loan_because: I know how difficult it can be to get started.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to empower people to achieve their dreams.

lenders.name: Nicol and Cameron
lenders.occupation: Personal Assistant & Owner of a online Granola Biz

lenders.name: Natalie
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microcredit loans are an important tool in creating a more just and peaceful world.
